title: 00165 - LIO's USB not working
message:
[B]USB port[/B] next to Card reader is working fine, but the USB on the LIO I/O is not working.
[LIST]
[*]i've already tried another flex cable and LIO I/O board.
[*]USB mouse, USB flash drive doesn't work.
[*]J9500 is very clean under the microscope
[/LIST] when i plug a usb device, osx will say "device is using too much power"

pin1 of usb port has 5.1v.
usb_pwn_en is 3.3v



diode mode on J9500 :

pin 3 - 0.474
pin 36 - 0.434
pin 38 - 0.434
pin 42 - 0367
pin 44 - 0.365

these measurements are same as a known working board. so I don't know what else to check...


bad cpu??

title: 00165 - LIO's USB not working
message:
Check R1581.
Post diode mode to ground for XDP_USB_EXTB_OC_L signal.

title: 00165 - LIO's USB not working
message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 46159"]Check R1581.
Post diode mode to ground for XDP_USB_EXTB_OC_L signal.[/QUOTE]

bingo! now I know for next time :)

[IMG type="full"]https://i.imgur.com/UrvN7R8.jpg[/IMG]

usb is working now.


----------------

title: 00165 - LIO's USB not working
message:
forgot to mention, isight doesn't work. I've already tried aknown working display.

J4002 , pin12 has 5v,
PP1V8_CAM has 1.8v
PP1V35_CAM has 1.3v
pp1v2_cam has 0v

pp1v2_cam is shorted to gnd. i'am checking what is shorted. could be bad u3900.

i'll need to remove L3901 to see where is the short.

title: 00165 - LIO's USB not working
message:
i've removed L3901

short is on pin1 of L3901

title: 00165 - LIO's USB not working
message:
removed u3900. 

pp1v2_cam short is gone.

title: 00165 - LIO's USB not working
message: replaced u3900 from a donor, isight is now back....took me almost 2 hours to reball this bga chip >.<

title: 00165 - LIO's USB not working
message: Cap Locks light doesn't lit up, but button is working. is this part of trackpad?

title: 00165 - LIO's USB not working
message: Amazing you replaced U3900 that's something I'd never attempt lol good job! Caps lock light sounds like bad keyboard to me. Tried another keyboard?

title: 00165 - LIO's USB not working
message:
lol thank you, this ain't my 1st time.
it's actually easy than it sounds. just reball and finding a working U3900 from a donor takes a lot of time. 3 out of 4 U3900 from donor boards were bad, i'll get a stencil for next time.


just tried another keyboard, the cap lock light still didn't work, then i tried another trackpad and it worked! thank god. i won't have to replace the keyboard

title: 00165 - LIO's USB not working
message: Nice yeah usually either keyboard or tpad in that case
